td.content: s:56 yr old M unemployed presents with severe headache since hitting the back of the head a short time ago. he also reports moderate nausea, mild vomiting, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the severe headache. he had 44 min LOC. o:Height 76 in, Weight 173 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 18, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:male unemployed aged 56 Ys presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 44 min). he denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. Furthermore, he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. he has a history of smoking describes drinking an average of 12 drinks a week for about 8 days in his past o:Height 75 in, Weight 169 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
